One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life by making extra effort.
One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up by making extra effort.
One person becomes fully extinguished in the present life without making extra effort.
One person becomes fully extinguished when the body breaks up without making extra effort.
How a person becomes fully extinguished: Meditates observing the ugliness of the body
Perceives the repulsiveness of food
Perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world
Observes the impermanence of all conditions
Has well established the perception of their own death
Relies on the five powers of a trainee: faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom
These five faculties manifest in them strongly: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom
